original: Majjhima Nikāya 113
analyzed: majjhima nikāya
translated: Middle Length Discourses

original: Sappurisasutta
analyzed: sappurisa sutta
translated: The True Person

original: Evaṁ me sutaṁ—
analyzed: evam me suta
translated: Thus have I heard.

original: ekaṁ samayaṁ bhagavā sāvatthiyaṁ viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme.
analyzed: ekam samayam bhagavā sāvatthiyam viharati jetavane anāthapiṇḍikassa ārāme
translated: On one occasion the Blessed One was dwelling at Sāvatthī in Jeta’s Grove, Anāthapiṇḍika’s Park.

original: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
analyzed: tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi
translated: There the Blessed One addressed the bhikkhus thus:

original: “bhikkhavo”ti.
analyzed: bhikkhavaḥ ti
translated: “Bhikkhus!”

original: “Bhadante”ti te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: bhadanta iti te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ
translated: “Venerable sir!” those bhikkhus replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Blessed One said this:

original: “sappurisadhammañca vo, bhikkhave, desessāmi asappurisadhammañca.
analyzed: sappurisa dhammañca vaḥ bhikkhave desessāmi a sappurisa dhammañca
translated: “Bhikkhus, I will teach you the Dhamma of the true person and the Dhamma of the untrue person.

original: Taṁ suṇātha, sādhukaṁ manasi karotha, bhāsissāmī”ti.
analyzed: tam suṇātha sādhukam manasi karotha bhāsissāmi iti
translated: Listen and attend closely to what I shall say.”

original: “Evaṁ, bhante”ti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato paccassosuṁ.
analyzed: eva bhante iti kho te bhikkhū bhagavato
translated: “Yes, venerable sir,” the bhikkhus replied.

original: Bhagavā etadavoca:
analyzed: bhagavān etat avoca
translated: The Blessed One said this:

original: “Katamo ca, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo?
analyzed: katamaḥ ca bhikkhave asappurisa dhammaḥ
translated: “And what, bhikkhus, is the Dhamma of the untrue person?

original: Idha, bhikkhave, asappuriso uccākulā pabbajito hoti.
analyzed: idha bhikkhave asappurisaḥ uccākulā pabbajitaḥ hoti
translated: Here, bhikkhus, an untrue person has gone forth from an aristocratic family.

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: He reflects thus:

original: ‘ahaṁ khomhi uccākulā pabbajito, ime panaññe bhikkhū na uccākulā pabbajitā’ti.
analyzed: aham khomhi uccākulā pabbajitaḥ ime pana aññe bhikkhū na uccākulā pabbajitā ti
translated: ‘I have gone forth from an aristocratic family. But these other bhikkhus have not gone forth from aristocratic families.’

original: So tāya uccākulīnatāya attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ tāya ucca akulīna tāya attā anukkasā iti param vambheti
translated: He extols himself and disparages others because of his aristocratic family.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.
analyzed: bhikkhave asappurisa dhammo
translated: This is the Dhamma of an untrue man.

original: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: sappuriso ca kho bhikkhave iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: But a true man considers thus:

original: ‘na kho uccākulīnatāya lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: na kho ucca akulīna tāya lobha dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti dosa dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti moha dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti
translated: ‘It’s not because of high birth that states of greed, hatred, and delusion are destroyed.

original: No cepi uccākulā pabbajito hoti;🔽so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
analyzed: no ce ipi uccākulā pabbajito hoti  so ca hoti dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipanno sāmīci ppaṭipannaḥ anudhamma cārī so tattha pujjo so tattha pāsaso ti
translated: Even though one may have gone forth from a high family,🔽if one practices in accordance with the Dhamma, conducts oneself according to the Dhamma, lives in accordance with the Dhamma, upholds the Teacher’s instructions, and lives in conformity with the Dhamma - then one is worthy of offerings, worthy of hospitality, worthy of gifts, and worthy of reverential salutations.

original: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tāya uccākulīnatāya nevattānukkaṁseti na paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ paṭipadayā iva antaram karitvā tāya ucca akulīna tāya na param vambheti
translated: One should not exalt oneself for one’s high birth or disparage others.’

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, sappurisadhammo.
analyzed: bhikkhave sappurisa dhammo
translated: This is the Dhamma of a true man.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso mahākulā pabbajito hoti …pe…🔽mahābhogakulā pabbajito hoti …pe…
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave asappurisaḥ mahā kulā pabbajitaḥ hoti pe  mahābhogakulā pabbajitaḥ hoti pe
translated: “Again, an untrue man may have gone forth from a great clan…🔽from a very wealthy clan…

original: uḷārabhogakulā pabbajito hoti.
analyzed: uḷāra bhoga kulā pabbajitaḥ hoti
translated: from a very rich clan.

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: He considers this and thinks:

original: ‘ahaṁ khomhi uḷārabhogakulā pabbajito, ime panaññe bhikkhū na uḷārabhogakulā pabbajitā’ti.
analyzed: aham khomhi uḷāra bhoga kulā pabbajitaḥ ime pana aññe bhikkhū na uḷāra bhoga kulā pabbajitā ti
translated: ‘I’ve gone forth from a wealthy, influential family, but these other monks haven’t.’

original: So tāya uḷārabhogatāya attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ tāya uḷāra bhoga tāya attā anukkasā iti param vambheti
translated: He extols himself and disparages others because of his wealth and influence.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave asappurisa dhammo
translated: This is the way of an untrue person.

original: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: sappuriso ca kho bhikkhave iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: But a true person considers this:

original: ‘na kho uḷārabhogatāya lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: na kho uḷāra bhoga tāya lobha dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti dosa dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti moha dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti
translated: ‘Wealth and influence don’t get rid of greed, hatred, and delusion.

original: No cepi uḷārabhogakulā pabbajito hoti;
analyzed: no ce ipi uḷāra bhoga kulā pabbajitaḥ hoti
translated: Even if you haven’t gone forth from a wealthy, influential family,

original: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
analyzed: so ca hoti dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipanno sāmīci ppaṭipannaḥ anudhamma cārī so tattha pujjo so tattha pāsaso ti
translated: if you practice in line with the Teaching, practice in line with the training, and practice in line with the Teacher’s instruction, you’re worthy of offerings, worthy of hospitality, worthy of gifts, and worthy of respect.’

original: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tāya uḷārabhogatāya nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ paṭipadayā iva antaram karitvā tāya uḷāra bhoga tāya na param vambheti
translated: He doesn’t extol himself or disparage others because of his wealth and influence.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, sappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave sappurisa dhammo
translated: This is the way of a true person.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso ñāto hoti yasassī.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave asappurisaḥ ñātaḥ hoti yasassī
translated: Furthermore, an untrue person is well-known and famous.

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: He reflects thus:

original: ‘ahaṁ khomhi ñāto yasassī, ime panaññe bhikkhū appaññātā appesakkhā’ti.
analyzed: aham khomhi ñātaḥ yasassī ime pana aññe bhikkhū appaññātā appesakkhā ati
translated: ‘I am well known and famous, but these other monks are unknown and of no account.’

original: So tena ñattena attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ tena ñattena attā anukkaseti param vambheti
translated: He extols himself and disparages others because of that fame.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave asappurisa dhammo
translated: This, bhikkhus, is the quality of a non-human being.

original: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: sappuriso ca kho bhikkhave iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: But a human being reflects thus:

original: ‘na kho ñattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: na kho ñattena lobha dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti dosa dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti moha dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti
translated: ‘Fame does not remove greed, hatred, or delusion, nor does it make greed, hatred, or delusion subside.

original: No cepi ñāto hoti yasassī;
analyzed: no ce pi ñātaḥ hoti yasassī
translated: Even if one is not famous,

original: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
analyzed: so ca hoti dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipanno sāmīci ppaṭipannaḥ anudhamma cārī so tattha pujjo so tattha pāsaso ti
translated: if one is a person who practices in accordance with the Dhamma, who practices in the proper way, and who conducts himself righteously, then one is worthy of offerings and praise.’

original: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tena ñattena nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ paṭipadayā iva antaram karitvā tena ñattena na param vambheti
translated: He does not extol himself and disparage others because of that fame.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, sappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave sappurisa dhammo
translated: This, bhikkhus, is the quality of a human being.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso lābhī hoti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṁ.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave asappurisaḥ lābhī hoti cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhārāna
translated: “Again, an untrue man obtains robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicinal requisites.

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: He thinks:

original: ‘ahaṁ khomhi lābhī cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṁ, ime panaññe bhikkhū na lābhino cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānan’ti.
analyzed: aham khomhi lābhī cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhārāna ime pana aññe bhikkhū na lābhinaḥ cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna ppaccaya bhesajja parikkhārānanti
translated: ‘I obtain robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicinal requisites, but these other bhikkhus do not obtain them.’

original: So tena lābhena attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ tena lābhena attā anukkaseti param vambheti
translated: He extols himself and disparages others because of his gains.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave asappurisa dhammo
translated: This is the way of an untrue man.

original: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: sappuriso ca kho bhikkhave iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: “But a true man considers thus:

original: ‘na kho lābhena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: na kho lābhena lobha dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti dosa dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti moha dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti
translated: ‘Gains do not destroy a person of greedy nature, of hateful nature, or of deluded nature.

original: No cepi lābhī hoti cīvarapiṇḍapātasenāsanagilānappaccayabhesajjaparikkhārānaṁ;
analyzed: no ce pi lābhī hoti cīvara piṇḍapāta senāsana gilāna paccaya bhesajja parikkhārāna
translated: Even if one does not obtain robes, alms-food, lodgings, and medicinal requisites,

original: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
analyzed: so ca hoti dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipanno sāmīci ppaṭipannaḥ anudhamma cārī so tattha pujjo so tattha pāsaso ti
translated: and he practices in accordance with the Dhamma, practices the practice of the good person, and conducts himself according to the Dhamma, then he is worthy of offerings, worthy of hospitality, worthy of respect, and worthy of reverential salutation.

original: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tena lābhena nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ paṭipadayā iva antaram karitvā tena lābhena na param vambheti
translated: But he does not, on account of that gain, praise himself or disparage others.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, sappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave sappurisa dhammo
translated: This is the way of the good person.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso bahussuto hoti.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave asappurisaḥ bahu sutaḥ hoti
translated: “Again, an untrue man is learned.

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: He reflects thus:

original: ‘ahaṁ khomhi bahussuto, ime panaññe bhikkhū na bahussutā’ti.
analyzed: aham khomhi bahussutaḥ ime pana aññe bhikkhū na bahussutā ti
translated: ‘I am learned, but these other bhikkhus are not.’

original: So tena bāhusaccena attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ tena bāhusaccena attā anukkaseti param vambheti
translated: He extols himself and disparages others on account of his learning.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave asappurisa dhammo
translated: This is the way of the untrue man.

original: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: sappuriso ca kho bhikkhave iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: But a true man reflects thus:

original: ‘na kho bāhusaccena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: na kho bāhusaccena lobha dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti dosa dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti moha dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti
translated: ‘Learning does not destroy the effluents that lead to rebirth in a future existence.

original: No cepi bahussuto hoti;
analyzed: no ce ipi bahu sutaḥ hoti
translated: Even if one is not learned,

original: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
analyzed: so ca hoti dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipanno sāmīci ppaṭipannaḥ anudhamma cārī so tattha pujjo so tattha pāsaso ti
translated: and he practices in accordance with the Dhamma, practices the practice of the good person, and conducts himself well, then he is worthy of offerings, worthy of hospitality, worthy of respect, and worthy of reverential salutation.

original: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tena bāhusaccena nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ paṭipadayā iva antaram karitvā tena bāhusaccena na ivattā anukkaseti na param vambheti
translated: But he does not, on account of that learning, exalt himself or disparage others.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, sappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave sappurisa dhammo
translated: This is the Dhamma of a good person.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso vinayadharo hoti.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave asappurisaḥ vinaya dharaḥ hoti
translated: “Again, an untrue man is a master of the Monastic Law.

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: He thinks:

original: ‘ahaṁ khomhi vinayadharo, ime panaññe bhikkhū na vinayadharā’ti.
analyzed: aham khomhi vinaya dharaḥ ime pana aññe bhikkhū na vinaya dharā ti
translated: ‘I’m a master of the Monastic Law, but these other monks aren’t.’

original: So tena vinayadharattena attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ tena attā anukkaseti param vambheti
translated: And he exalts himself for being a master of the Monastic Law and disparages others.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave asappurisa dhammo
translated: This is the Dhamma of an untrue man.

original: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: sappuriso ca kho bhikkhave iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: But a good person thinks:

original: ‘na kho vinayadharattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: na kho vinaya dharattena lobha dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti dosa dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti moha dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti
translated: ‘Being a master of the Monastic Law doesn’t get rid of the mental qualities of greed, hate, and delusion.

original: No cepi vinayadharo hoti;
analyzed: no ced ipi vinaya dharaḥ
translated: Even if you’re not a master of the Monastic Law,

original: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
analyzed: so ca hoti dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipanno sāmīci ppaṭipannaḥ anudhamma cārī so tattha pujjo so tattha pāsaso ti
translated: and he practices in accordance with the Dhamma, practices the practice of the good Dhamma, and conducts himself according to the Dhamma—he is worthy of offerings, he is worthy of hospitality, he is worthy of alms, he is worthy of respect, he is worthy of the greeting ‘venerable,’ and he is worthy of the position of teacher.

original: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tena vinayadharattena nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ paṭipadayā iva antaram karitvā tena vinaya dharattena na param vambheti
translated: He does not, on account of his knowledge of the Monastic Law, praise and exalt himself and disparage and look down on others.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, sappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave sappurisa dhammo
translated: This is the way of a true person.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso dhammakathiko hoti.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave asappurisaḥ dhamma kathikaḥ hoti
translated: “A true person has this further characteristic of a true person:

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: He thinks:

original: ‘ahaṁ khomhi dhammakathiko, ime panaññe bhikkhū na dhammakathikā’ti.
analyzed: aham khomhi dhamma kathiko ime pana aññe bhikkhū na dhamma kathikā ti
translated: ‘I am a Dhamma speaker, but these other monks are not Dhamma speakers.’

original: So tena dhammakathikattena attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: so tena dhamma kathika ttena attā anukkaseti param vambheti
translated: He praises and exalts himself and disparages and looks down on others because of being a Dhamma speaker.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave asappurisa dhammo
translated: This is the way of an untrue person.

original: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: sappuriso ca kho bhikkhave iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: A true person reflects thus:

original: ‘na kho dhammakathikattena lobhadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, dosadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti, mohadhammā vā parikkhayaṁ gacchanti.
analyzed: na kho dhamma kathika ttena lobha dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti dosa dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti moha dhammāḥ vā parikkhayam gacchanti
translated: ‘The things that lead to greed, hatred, and delusion do not disappear just because one is a Dhamma speaker.

original: No cepi dhammakathiko hoti;
analyzed: no ce ipi dhamma kathikaḥ hoti
translated: Even if one is not a Dhamma speaker,

original: so ca hoti dhammānudhammappaṭipanno sāmīcippaṭipanno anudhammacārī, so tattha pujjo, so tattha pāsaṁso’ti.
analyzed: so ca hoti dhamma anudhamma ppaṭipanno sāmīci ppaṭipannaḥ anudhamma cārī so tattha pujjo so tattha pāsaso ti
translated: and he practices in accordance with the Dhamma, following the Dhamma, and he has accepted the practice of the Dhamma out of faith, then he is worthy of offerings, of hospitality, of gifts, and of reverential salutation, and he is the foremost field of merit in the world.’

original: So paṭipadaṁyeva antaraṁ karitvā tena dhammakathikattena nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ paṭipadayā iva antaram karitvā tena dhamma kathika ttena na iva attā anukkaseti na param vambheti
translated: “Having made the practice the foremost thing, he does not, on account of that virtue and practice, exalt himself or disparage others.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, sappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave sappurisa dhammo
translated: This, bhikkhus, is the Dhamma of a true man.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso āraññiko hoti.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave asappurisaḥ āraññikaḥ hoti
translated: “Again, an untrue man is a forest dweller.

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:

translated: Keeping this in mind, he neither extols himself nor disparages others because of his attainment of the base of infinite space.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, sappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave sappurisa dhammo
translated: This is the Dhamma of a good person.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso sabbaso ākāsānañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘anantaṁ viññāṇan’ti viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave asappurisaḥ sabbaso ākāsānañca āyatanam samatikkamma anantam viññāṇanti viññāṇañcāyatanam upasampajja viharati
translated: “Again, an adherent does not completely surmount the base of infinite space, but focuses on the base of infinite consciousness,

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: He reflects thus:

original: ‘ahaṁ khomhi viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime panaññe bhikkhū viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattiyā na lābhino’ti.
analyzed: aham khomhi viññāṇañcāyatana samāpattiyā lābhī ime pana aññe bhikkhū viññāṇañcāyatana samāpattiyā na lābhino ti
translated: ‘I have attained the base of infinite consciousness, but these other bhikkhus have not attained it.’

original: So tāya viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattiyā attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: so tāya viññāṇañcāyatana samāpattiyā attā anukkaseti param vambheti
translated: He extols himself and disparages others because of his attainment of the base of infinite consciousness.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave asappurisa dhammo
translated: This is the quality of a bad person.

original: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: sappuriso ca kho bhikkhave iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: But a good person reflects thus:

original: ‘viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattiyāpi kho atammayatā vuttā bhagavatā.
analyzed: viññāṇañcāyatana samāpattiyā api kho atammaya tā vuttā bhagavatā
translated: ‘The Blessed One has said that there is nothing so dear to a being as itself.

original: Yena yena hi maññanti tato taṁ hoti aññathā’ti.
analyzed: yena yena hi maññanti tatas tam hoti aññathā ati
translated: But what one regards as oneself is just what one’s self is not.

original: So atammayataññeva antaraṁ karitvā tāya viññāṇañcāyatanasamāpattiyā nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ antaram karitvā tāya viññāṇaṃ ca āyatana samāpattiyā na iva attā anukkaseti na param vambheti
translated: ’ He does not extol himself and disparage others because of his attainment of the base of infinite consciousness.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, sappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave sappurisa dhammo
translated: This is the quality of a good person.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso sabbaso viññāṇañcāyatanaṁ samatikkamma ‘natthi kiñcī’ti ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave asappurisaḥ sabbasas viññāṇañca āyatanam samatikkamma na atthi kiñci iti ākiñcaññāyatanam upasampajja viharati
translated: “Again, an untrue man, by completely surmounting the base of infinite consciousness, aware that ‘there is nothing,’ enters upon and abides in the base of nothingness.

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: He reflects thus:

original: ‘ahaṁ khomhi ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime panaññe bhikkhū ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattiyā na lābhino’ti.
analyzed: aham khomhi ākiñcaññāyatana samāpattiyā lābhī ime pana aññe bhikkhū ākiñcaññāyatana samāpattiyā na lābhino ti
translated: ‘I’ve attained the base of nothingness, but these other monks haven’t.’

original: So tāya ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattiyā attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ tāya ākiñcaññāyatana samāpattiyāḥ attā anukkaseti param vambheti
translated: He extols himself and disparages others on account of his attainment of the base of nothingness.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave asappurisa dhammo
translated: This is the sort of person who is not an ascetic or a brahmin.

original: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: sappuriso ca kho bhikkhave iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: But a true person reflects:

original: ‘ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattiyāpi kho atammayatā vuttā bhagavatā.
analyzed: ākiñcaññāyatana samāpattiyā api kho atammaya tā vuttā bhagavatā
translated: ‘The Buddha has said that the base of nothingness is not ultimate.

original: Yena yena hi maññanti tato taṁ hoti aññathā’ti.
analyzed: yena yena hi maññanti tatas tam hoti aññathā ati
translated: Whatever you think about, that will turn out different.’

original: So atammayataññeva antaraṁ karitvā tāya ākiñcaññāyatanasamāpattiyā nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ antaram karitvā tāya ākiñcaññāyatana samāpattiyāḥ na param vambheti
translated: He doesn’t extol himself and disparage others on account of his attainment of the base of nothingness.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, sappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave sappurisa dhammo
translated: This is the sort of person who is an ascetic and a brahmin.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, asappuriso sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ upasampajja viharati.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave asappurisaḥ sabbaso ākiñcaññāyatanam samatikkamma nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam upasampajja viharati
translated: “Furthermore, an untrue person, by completely surmounting the base of nothingness, enters and remains in the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: So iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: saḥ iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: He reflects:

original: ‘ahaṁ khomhi nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā lābhī, ime panaññe bhikkhū nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā na lābhino’ti.
analyzed: aham khomhi neva saññā nāsañña āyatana samāpattiyāḥ lābhī ime pana aññe bhikkhū neva saññā nāsañña āyatana samāpattiyāḥ na lābhino ti
translated: ‘I’ve attained the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, but these other monks haven’t.’

original: So tāya nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā attānukkaṁseti, paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ tāya nevasaññānāsaññāyatana samāpattiyā attā anukkaseti param vambheti
translated: He extols himself and disparages others because of his attainment of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, asappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave asappurisa dhammo
translated: This is not the Dhamma.

original: Sappuriso ca kho, bhikkhave, iti paṭisañcikkhati:
analyzed: sappuriso ca kho bhikkhave iti paṭisañcikkhati
translated: But a true person reflects:

original: ‘nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyāpi kho atammayatā vuttā bhagavatā.
analyzed: nevasaññā nāsañña āyatana samāpattiyā api kho atammaya tā vuttā bhagavatā
translated: ‘The Buddha says that the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception is not ultimate.

original: Yena yena hi maññanti tato taṁ hoti aññathā’ti.
analyzed: yena yena hi maññanti tatas tam hoti aññathā ati
translated: Whatever is thought out and considered is seen to be otherwise.’

original: So atammayataññeva antaraṁ karitvā tāya nevasaññānāsaññāyatanasamāpattiyā nevattānukkaṁseti, na paraṁ vambheti.
analyzed: saḥ antaram karitvā tāya nevasaññānāsaññāyatana samāpattiyā na param vambheti
translated: He doesn’t extol himself and disparage others because of his attainment of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception.

original: Ayampi, bhikkhave, sappurisadhammo.
analyzed: ayam pi bhikkhave sappurisa dhammo
translated: This is the Dhamma.

original: Puna caparaṁ, bhikkhave, sappuriso sabbaso nevasaññānāsaññāyatanaṁ samatikkamma saññāvedayitanirodhaṁ upasampajja viharati. Paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇā honti.
analyzed: puna capara bhikkhave sappurisaḥ sabbasas nevasaññānāsaññāyatanam samatikkamma saññā vedayita nirodham upasampajja viharati paññāya cassa disvā āsavā parikkhīṇāḥ honti
translated: “Again, a good person, with the complete surmounting of the base of neither-perception-nor-non-perception, enters & remains in the cessation of perception & feeling. With the cessation of his body, his defilements are completely ended.

original: Ayaṁ, bhikkhave, bhikkhu na kiñci maññati, na kuhiñci maññati, na kenaci maññatī”ti.
analyzed: bhikkhave bhikkhu na kiñci maññati na kuhiñci maññati na kenaci maññati iti
translated: This bhikkhu does not conceive anything, does not conceive in terms of anything, does not conceive from anything, does not conceive, ‘I am conceiving.’“

original: Idamavoca bhagavā.🔽Attamanā te bhikkhū bhagavato bhāsitaṁ abhinandunti.
analyzed: idam avoca bhagavān  attamanāḥ te bhikkhū bhagavataḥ bhāsitam abhinandunti
translated: That is what the Blessed One said.🔽Having said that, the One Well-Gone, the Teacher, said further:

original: Sappurisasuttaṁ niṭṭhitaṁ tatiyaṁ.
analyzed: sappurisa suttam niṭṭhitam tatiya
translated: The discourse on the good person is finished.
